definitions.definition: The act of reserving, withholding or keeping back.
definitions.example: The committee authorised the reservation of funds.

definitions.definition: Something that is withheld or kept back.
(often in the plural) A limiting qualification; a doubt.
definitions.example: I have reservations about your intentions.

definitions.definition: A tract of land set apart by the US government for the use of a Native American people; Indian reservation (compare Canadian reserve).
An arrangement by which accommodation or transport arrangements are secured in advance.
definitions.example: I have a hotel reservation in the name of Mr Smith.

definitions.definition: The area which separates opposing lanes of traffic on a divided motorway or dual carriageway; see also central reservation.
definitions.example: A vehicle crashed through the central reservation into the path of oncoming traffic.

definitions.definition: The setting aside of a certain percentage of vacancies in government institutions for members of backward and underrepresented communities (defined primarily by caste and tribe).
